A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: The Last Jedi is a very hard pill to swallow. Rian Johnson has some very strange ideas about most of the long-standing ideas Star Wars has been known for. This translates into a strange viewing experience\, especially on the first time around. I very much appreciate Rian's dedication to breaking the mold and switching things up. This is unlike any Star Wars film ever released - which is why Audience scores are so mediocore - but I ask you to trust me: The Last Jedi is a Star Wars film that is unexpected at almost every turn. Your first viewing is going to feel incredibly strange\, but it was a necessary step for the franchise to keep it from falling into a pit of repetitive nonsense that we have already seen multiple times via the franchise. If you are unsure your first time\, give it a second chance - it deserves the high critic reviews.
